  • Method Details

    • createEvent

      @PostMapping(path="/events") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto> createEvent(@RequestBody com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto event, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Creates a new Event.

      POST/events

      Parameters:
      event - Json Body. Expected fields:
      • name(String, required)
      • description(String, optional)
      • bannerUrl(String, optional), url to the banner image stored on the server, if the event has one
      • dates(List of dates, required) in format "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm"
        • startsAt(date, optional), if left null it will start at creation
        • endsAt(date, required)
      userToken - Token to verify user and link as creator.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with status 201 and the created event, containing its autogenerated id.

      Possible Errors:

      • 400 Bad Request - Missing fields or wrongly parsed Json.
      • 401 Unauthorized - Missing or invalid token.

      Example JSON:

       {"name": "Example Event", "description": "An Example Event", "bannerUrl": "imageLink", "dates": { "startsAt":
 "2025-09-01T09:00", "endsAt": "2025-09-01T17:00"}}

    • listEvents

      @GetMapping(path="/events") @ResponseBody public List<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto> listEvents()
      Get existing Events.

      GET/events

      Returns:
      a list of Events with status 200.

    • getEvent

      @GetMapping(path="/events/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto> getEvent(@PathVariable("id") Integer id)
      Get a specific Event.

      GET/events/{id}

      Parameters:
      id - The Events id.
      Returns:
      The Event with the specific id with status 200.

      Possible Errors:

      • 404 Not Found - If no events exists with the id.

    • fullUpdateEvent

      @PutMapping(path="/events/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto> fullUpdateEvent(@PathVariable("id") Integer id, @RequestBody com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto eventDto, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Full update of an Event. Anything left blank will be updated to blank.

      PUT/events/{id}

      Parameters:
      id - Id of the event that will be updated.
      eventDto - Json Body. Expected fields:
      • id(Integer, optional), will be overwritten by {id} in the url
      • name(String, required)
      • description(String, optional)
      • bannerUrl(String, optional), url to the banner image stored on the server, if the event has one
      • dates(List of dates, not required), no dates except updatedAt can be changed, but that is done by the server.
      userToken - Token to verify user and make sure that it is an Admin for the Event.
      Returns:
      A responseEntity with status 200 containing the updated Event.

      Possible Errors:

      • 404 Not Found - If Event with id doesn't exist.
      • 401 Unauthorized - If Token is invalid or cant be linked to a user.
      • 403 Forbidden - If the user from token is not an admin for the Event.

      Example JSON:

          {"name": "Example Event", "description": "An Example Event that is updated", "bannerUrl": "imageLink"}

    • partialUpdateEvent

      @PatchMapping(path="/events/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto> partialUpdateEvent(@PathVariable("id") Integer id, @RequestBody com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto eventDto, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Partial update of an Event. A Partial update only updates fields that are sent, empty fields are ignored.

      PATCH/events/{id}

      Parameters:
      id - Id of the event that will be updated.
      eventDto - Json Body. Expected fields:
      • id(Integer, optional), will be overwritten by {id} in the url
      • name(String, optional)
      • description(String, optional)
      • bannerUrl(String, optional), url to the banner image stored on the server, if the event has one
      • dates(List of dates, not required), no dates except updatedAt can be changed, but that is done by the server.
      userToken - Token to verify user and make sure that it is an Admin for the Event.
      Returns:
      A responseEntity with status 200 containing the updated Event.

      Possible Errors:

      • 404 Not Found - If Event with id doesn't exist.
      • 401 Unauthorized - If Token is invalid or cant be linked to a user.
      • 403 Forbidden - If the user from token is not an admin for the Event.

      Example JSON:

          {"name": "Example Event", "bannerUrl": "newimageLink"}

    • deleteEvent

      @DeleteMapping(path="/events/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteEvent(@PathVariable("id") Integer id, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Deletes an Event.

      DELETE/events/{id}

      Parameters:
      id - Id of Event to be deleted
      userToken - Token to verify user and make sure that it is an Admin for the Event.
      Returns:
      Status 204

      Possible Errors:

      • 404 Not Found - If Event doesn't Exist.
      • 401 Unauthorized - If token is invalid or cant be linked to a user.
      • 403 Forbidden - If the user isn't an Admin for the Event.

    • addAdminToEvent

      @PatchMapping(path="/events/{id}/admins/add/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto> addAdminToEvent(@PathVariable("id") Integer id, @PathVariable("email") String email, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Add a new Admin to an Event.

      PATCH/events/{id}/admins/add{email}

      Parameters:
      id - Id of the Event.
      email - Email of the user to be added as admin.
      userToken - Token of the user adding the other user as an admin.
      Returns:
      The event and status code 200, the event will not be showing any difference on front end though.

      Possible Errors

      • 401 Unauthorized - If the token is invalid.
      • 403 Forbidden - If the User trying to add someone isn't an admin themselves
      • 404 Not Found - If the user to add doesn't exist, or the event doesn't exist.
      • 409 Conflict - If max admins has already been reached, or the new admin is already an admin for the event

    • leaveEventAsAdmin

      @PatchMapping(path="/events/{id}/admins/leave") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.pvt.project71.domain.dto.EventDto> leaveEventAsAdmin(@PathVariable("id") Integer id, @AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt userToken)
      Leave as an admin. You can't kick out anyone but yourself from the admins.
      Parameters:
      id - Id for the event to leave as admin.
      userToken - Token of the user leaving.
      Returns:
      The Event with status 200.

      Possible Errors:

      • 401 Unauthorized - If the token is invalid or can't be linked to a user.
      • 404 Not Found - If the user is not an Admin, or the Event doesn't exist
